titlestmt.titleproper: William R. Birch autobiographical notes undated
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

scopecontent.p: Typescript copy of notes of notes by William R. Birch, painter and engraver, covering his career in in England, his move gto America, 1794, and first years in that country. There are also a few pages on enamel painting, and annotated lists of some of his paintings and engravings. [This autobiographical material was given to Albert Rosenthal by Edward Bury of Philadelphia. The original typewritten copy given him by Bury is deposited with HSP (2 volumes). Rosenthal made two copies of the typescript at HSP; one is in the possession of the New York Historical Society. The family requested that the manuscript not be published.] HSP Collection #1581.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.
